document.docAuthor: Zhu, Jia-Chen, Achterberg, Cornelis Van & Chen, Xue-Xin
document.docTitle: Alysia polita Zhu & Achterberg & Chen 2018, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Alysia Latreille (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Alysiinae), with description of six new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Alysia Latreille (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Alysiinae), with description of six new species from China

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 7. Alysia polita sp. n., ♀, holotype, habitus, lateral aspect.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 8. Alysia polita sp. n., ♀, holotype. A, fore wing; B, hind wing; C, mesosoma, dorsal aspect; D, mesosoma, lateral aspect; E, propodeum, first and second metasomal tergites, dorsal aspect; F, propodeum and metasoma, dorsal aspect; G, basal segments of antenna, lateral aspect; H, head, dorsal aspect; I, head, anterior aspect; J, head, lateral aspect; K, mandible, full view on first and second teeth; L, mandible, full view on third tooth; M, ovipositor and ovipositor sheath, lateral aspect.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
Holotype , ♀ ( ZJUH ), “
[NE. China :] Jilin
, Mt. Changbai , 9.?.1977, He Junhua, No. 770587”
.
Paratypes : 1♀ ( ZJUH ), same data as holotype, but No. 770649
;
2♂ , same data as holotype, but No. 770594, 770637
;
2♂ , same data as holotype, but 8.?.1977, Zhang Yancheng, No. 790023, 790024
.

Description .
Holotype , ♀ , length of body 4.2 mm , of fore wing 4.8 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Alysia polita
sp. n.
, ♀, holotype, habitus, lateral aspect.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. body length of male 3.9–4.3 mm , and length of fore wing 4.1–4.4 mm , antennal segments of male 44 (1), 45 (1); body length of female 3.9–4.2 mm , and length of fore wing 4.4–4.8 mm , antennal segments of female 41(1) or 44 (1).

Comparative diagnosis. This species is similar to
A. nudinotum Wharton
but differs by having the first metasomal tergite smooth ( versus longitudinally carinate in
A. nudinotum
); width of head twice its lateral length ( versus 1.6 times); length of first tergite almost equal to its apical width ( versus 1.6 times); second–third metasomal tergites black, ( versus yellowish brown to pale brown).

Etymology .
Named “
polita
” because of the mainly smooth first metasomal tergite: “ politus ” is Latin for “smooth”.
